Pucherin

Welcome to the game of Pucherin, a classical Spanish board game from the 40's.
From 2 to 6 players.

How to play Pucherin:

These are the rules of the original board game. Most of the actions required to play the game are done automatically in this browser version.

  • Players play in turns.
  • Each player throws two dice, sums the outcome and then places a token in the corresponding cell.
  • If a cell gets full, the last player to place a token in the cell gets all the tokens from said cell.
  • If a 7 is rolled, a token is added to the puchero.
  • If a 12 is rolled, the player gets all the tokens inside the puchero.
  • If a player hasn't got any more tokens to place, they get all the tokens remaining in the cell.
  • If all players haven't got any more tokens to place, the first player to roll a 12 gets all the remaining tokens in the board, including the puchero.
  • When no more tokens remain in the board, the game finishes.
  • The player with the most picked tokens wins.
  • Tokens picked from the board cannot be placed again.
